style.description: American pale ales range from deep golden to copper in color. The style is characterized by fruity, floral and citrus-like American-variety hop character producing medium to medium-high hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma. Note that the "traditional" style of this beer has its origins with certain floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American hop varietals. One or more of these hop characters is the perceived end, but the perceived hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. American pale ales have medium body and low to medium maltiness. Low caramel character is allowable. Fruity-ester flavor and aroma should be moderate to strong. Diacetyl should be absent or present at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

data.name: Warmonger
data.description: We love having a beer at the brewery after work. Sometimes that's the only reason we even come to work. After a long day of slinging kegs or mucking out spent grain, we're usually in the mood for something light and clean. But sometimes we want something light that will also smack us around a little. That was the inspiration for Warmonger. It's not available all the time, but when it is we'll probably drink most of it ourselves.

breweries.name: Boylan Bridge Brewpub
breweries.description:
The Boylan Bridge Brewpub has a bright and open atmosphere conducive to conversation, business, and social interaction. The architectural millwork and cabinetwork built downstairs in the shop has made the Bridge a beautiful, durable facility using fine woods, ceramic tile, and canvas covered tackboard on the walls.

The brewing operation is visible from the bar through glass doors, offering an industrial connection with stainless steel tanks and copper piping throughout.

The most popular feature of the place is the outdoor deck. It offers an expansive view of the downtown Raleigh skyline. A wood post and beam pergola structure enclose the space and provides mottled shade without trapping sound, making conversation easy.

breweries.name: Hank Is Wiser Brewery
breweries.description: Hank is Wiser Brewery is a small family owned and operated brewpub located in the middle of downtown Cheney, Kansas.  The first house brewed beer was served on April 1, 2005 at their grand opening, just mere hours after Hank Sanford retired from a 22 year sales career in Wichita.  It was 35 years earlier that Hank had purchased his first beer sign.  Collecting brewery advertising, visiting over 300 breweries across the country, homebrewing for the last 15 years, and of course tasting well over 2000 different beers all lead to the dream and finally the reality of opening Hank is Wiser Brewery.

breweries.name: Karbach Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We like beer. A lot. 

Our background is in the beer biz. Everything from distribution and importing to German training and brewery operations. A few years ago we had an opportunity that would allow us to open up our own brewery. We jumped on it.

We’re extremely excited about this project, and we think it shows in everything we do. This is just plain fun for us. The day it starts to feel like a job is the day when lightning shall strike us dead. Cause, hey, at the end of the day we're making beer. And beer is fun.

Join us, it should be a kick ass ride with some cool stops along the way!

breweries.name: Moccasin Bend Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Moccasin Bend Brewing Company is located in the historic St. Elmo district of Chattanooga, TN.  We’re at the foot of Lookout Mountain just steps away from the world-famous Incline Railway and very near to the great Moccasin Bend of the Tennessee River. 

MBBC was started by two brewers whose quest for the perfect beer led them to learn the art of brewing.  Chris Hunt and Duncan Guy began their brewing education in the Barley Mob Brewers homebrewing club and continued to search for unique and distinctive ale and lager formulas. They decided to offer their creations to the public through a small batch microbrewery in 2006.  Soon thereafter, award-winning brewer Courtney Tyvand joined the two and presented his smoked porter at the brewery’s first beer dinner in October of 2006.

The brewery is located on the ground floor of a historic building at 4015 Tennessee Avenue in St. Elmo.  The building is constructed of foot-square cedar timbers and two-foot thick walls made of granite stone and mortar.  Built in 1911 as a packaging factory for K-Rations for WWI, we occasionally find artifacts from that era in the building walls and ceiling.  The brewery shares space with the Chattanooga U-Brew, a brew-on-premises business owned by Greg McCort. 

MBBC is proud to offer small batch specialty ales and lagers in kegs of various sizes.  A tasting room is part of the brewery; samples of our beers can be tasted and tested on premises.  Occasionally we have tasting events or tapping events at the brewery or at a nearby bar or restaurant.  Please check our calendar for scheduled tasting events at the brewery.

breweries.name: Hales Ales Brewery and Pub
breweries.description:
Founded by Mike Hale in 1983, Hale's Ales is the Northwest's 3rd oldest and longest running independently owned brewery in the Northwest. Hale's built its long standing reputation by brewing small batch, full flavored ales using traditional English brewing methods.

An innovator from the start, Hale's was the first craft brewery to introduce Seasonal, Cask Conditioned and Nitrogen Conditioned ales to the region. Hale's goal is to stay true to what the craft brewing "revolution" is all about: crafting fresh, locally brewed ales of the very finest quality. Cheers from Hale's Ales!

breweries.name: Blue Point Brewing
breweries.description:
Starting out in 1998 as two guys with a dog, a van, and a dream, Blue Point Brewing Company quickly became one of the nation’s premier microbreweries. After first launching our lightly toasted, complex, full-flavored Toasted Lager, we rapidly gained the respect of beer lovers far and wide. Soon after, we introduced several other brews and were being compared to breweries from noted craft-brewing capitals like Denver, Boston, Portland, and Seattle.

Brewing isn’t just our business, it’s our passion. We’re beer people. We started Blue Point Brewing Company because we wanted to make beer we would drink. To quench that desire, we select only top-quality ingredients and brew all-natural, unpasteurized beer. It’s this approach that put us on the world beer map. From the World Beer Cup to the Great American Beer Festival and the Australian International Beer Awards – we’re becoming noticed the world over. But we believe you should be the judge. Let us know what you think.

breweries.name: Sudwerk
breweries.description: Sudwerk brews and bottles Swiss Beer in Zürich Oberland.  Unlike others that brew “Pale Ale Style”  Our beer is brewed on an Authentic British Pale Ale Brew House using the finest English Pale Ale Malt, American Hops and Yeast.  I have been brewing American Pale Ales since 1982, back in the days when I brewed 20 Liters at a time as a homebrewer.  Today I brew 2000 Liters at a time (more friends then back then).  I grew up in Northern California during the Microbrewery Revolution and you will taste that in my beers. Of course I never pasteurize our beers or add anything artificial.  Trust me when I say, Beer coming from Pfäffikon to your dinner table will taste fresher than beer brought in a container traveling 2 months over the ocean.  Don’t just take our word for it, Biergenuss Magazine calls us “The Rothschild of Beer”. Thanks to all of you for making Western Rider the number one selling Pale Ale in Switzerland. Unlike many other brands, we are not brewed in Germany or in another Kanton and then sold as a “Local” or “Swiss Beer”. We are also not a big beer factory, owned by a European neighbor.  With every Sudwerk Beer, you are enjoying an Authentic Pale Ale produced here in Switzerland, by a family owned and operated “Kleinbrauerei”/Microbrewery. With every Sudwerk Beer, you enjoy the true meaning of Swiss Quality and the results of good old fashioned hard work.  You can find us in larger COOP Stores in the German and French speaking parts of Switzerland, on the Bahnhofstrasse in Jelmoli, Rio Getränke, Drinks of the World as well as in over 100 Restaurants and Hotels. In Zürich, we are distributed by Heineken Distribution, Intercomestibles AG and Schatt Getränke. Quality without compromise. If you are ever in the neighborhood, come by and visit us!  And do follow us on Twitter and Facebook.

breweries.name: Rogue Ales
breweries.description: Rogue Ales was founded in 1988 by Jack Joyce, Rob Strasser and Bob Woodell, three corporate types who wanted to go into the food/beverage industry. Rogue's first brewpub was located in Ashland, Oregon and was a 10bbl brewsystem. Rogue opened a second brewpub, 15bbl brewsystem, in May 1989 located in Newport, Oregon. Rogue closed its Ashland operation in 1997, after the great flood destroyed the place. In 1991, the 15bbl system, named Howard after John Maier's former boss, from the Newport brewpub was transferred across the bay to the current brewery and upgraded to a 30bbl system. In 1998 Rogue bought a 50bbl brewsystem, named Kobe. Kobe is the only brewsystem in use. Tours: We offer brewery tours every day at 3 pm (followed by a distillery tour at 4pm). Go up to the bar inside the brewery (Brewers on the Bay) and check in with the bartender and the tour will commence. Please call ahead if you have a large group and or to verify the tour time...Brewer's on the Bay phone is 541-867-3664. The view from Brewers on the Bay includes the marina (outside), and the bottling line and brew kettles (inside).

breweries.name: Great Lakes Brewing Company
breweries.description: In the 1870s, Cleveland had 30 breweries. By the early 1980s, the last one had shuttered its doors. So when brothers Patrick and Daniel Conway opened Great Lakes Brewing Company on September 6, 1988, it not only signaled a new era in Cleveland brewing, it was also the first microbrewery in the state of Ohio. And the idea of a craft brewery in Cleveland caught on fast, as curious patrons hurried in for a pint crafted in the styles of old and drawn from the taps of the beautiful Victorian era bar. The company's commitment to sustainable business practices greatly contributed to its early popularity and success. Before long, Great Lakes Brewing Company had become one of Cleveland's most popular destinations for both dining and a fun night out.

breweries.name: Heritage Brewing
breweries.description:
A UNIQUELY AMERICAN BREWERY

~ Established 2013 ~

We are a veteran owned and operated microbrewery in Manassas, VA. As veterans and patriots, we find that we owe it to our patrons to only produce the finest beer made with the best ingredients with the same level of attention to detail and passion that we brought to serving our country.

100% American sourced ingredients & Organic base malts

92% Locally sourced or Organic ingredients

1% Of every pint goes to charity

ORGANIC & SUSTAINABLE

It is worth the extra effort to pay a little more, make a little less and put a whole lot of elbow grease into things to make a better product. A better product that not only tastes great, but is also made in a responsible and sustainable way. We use 100% organic 2-Row in all of our beers and each of our beers is comprised of at least 90% organic ingredients. No genetic modification, no pesticides, no BS just great beer.

REUSE, RECYCLE & REDUCE

Elbow grease is an understatement to how we built our brewery. We spent hours on end thinking of ways for us to recycle, reuse and reduce our footprint. We started by making all of the furniture in the brewery out of shipping crates and pallets and continued with repurposing items to make our taproom. We may not have the capital just yet to have a ton of fancy energy recapturing devices, but we did create a way to recycle the water we use to chill out wort through a series of hoses so that the beer you drink was actually made from water that was used to chill our wort recapturing not only the water but also the heat reducing the energy it takes to heat our water. Think about it beer being made from making beer?

WHY DOES THIS MATTER?

We want to bring you the best beer while also making sure it is actually good for both you and the environment around you. So the next time you have a pint of Heritage be sure to stop and think about all that is going into the beer in front of you.

Come check out our taproom when your in northern Virginia or grab one of our beers on tap or in stores.

When we opened the doors to our beach town brew pub on Coronado Island in
1996, we wanted it to be the kind of place where friends count enjoy great
beer, a good meal and a laid-back atmosphere.
Now, years later, our brewery’s a lot bigger and we’ve gotten a number of
awards. But we’re still following that same dream: brewing exceptionallly
balanced beer that’s authentically inspired by our West Coast roots. And
offering that experience to an ever-growing family that seeks an undeniable
coastal vibe, and shares our passion for great beer.
Welcome to Coronado Brewing Company. A Coastal Calling.

breweries.name: Drafting Table Brewing Company
breweries.description: Drafting Table Brewing Company (DTBC) is located in the Village Center Area of Wixom, Michigan.  Through a culmination of 4 years of professional brewing and 8 years of homebrewing experience DTBC seeks to provide artisan craft beer to lovers of ales and lagers around Metro-Detroit.  By uniting selective combinations of ingredients with meticulous brewing practices we keep a high standard for the beer we produce.  In addition to ales and lagers, we serve Detroit native Faygo soda and small snacks.  We encourage guests to bring in food from our surrounding restaurants or even from their own kitchen since we do not have a kitchen. We look forward to providing you with a product we are proud to make in an atmosphere that makes you want to come back.

data.name: Whale Ale
data.description:
Murray's Whale Ale is a refreshing wheat beer with a twist. Its high percentage of malted and unmalted wheat and aromatic late hop profile gives a unique take on a session strength ale. A classic light body, creamy mouthfeel and refreshing citris flavour. This is balanced with assertive late hopping, giving a fresh, light tropical fruit aroma and cleansing dry finish.

Murray's Whale Ale is light gold in colour and lightly filtered to give it a sparkling appearance.

Summer in a glass!

breweries.name: Murray's Craft Brewing Co
breweries.description:
At Murray’s we are fanatical about the quality of our beers. We use only the best quality ingredients sourced from Australia and around the world and we give all of our beers extended conditioning times – no rushing.

Established in late 2006 by passionate craft beer enthusiast, Murray Howe, Murray’s Craft Brewing Co. has quickly gained a reputation as one of Aust best Craft Brewers. So much so that we were awarded ‘Best Brewer in Australia’ in October 2012. 

Crafted in Port Stephens on the beach on the NSW Hunter region our hugely sought-after range of unconventional, unique and sometimes just plain weird – full-flavoured beers are available across Australia.

We’re not a corporation and we’d NEVER lower our standards to sell more beer. Rest-assured our beers have won more awards than our ads. Murray’s is proudly 100% Australian-owned.

Murray’s… Made of the Right Stuff.

breweries.name: F.X. Matt Brewing Company
breweries.description: F.X. Matt Brewing Company is an American family-owned brewery at the foothills of the Adirondack Mountains in Utica, New York. It is the fourth oldest family-owned brewery in the United States after D. G. Yuengling & Son (1829), August Schell Brewing Company (1860), and Straub Brewery Inc. (1872). Its most popular product is the Saranac line of beers, although soft drinks such at Root Beer and Ginger Beer are also produced by the company.

breweries.name: Rough Draft Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We like beer. And word on the street is you do too. So you’ve been petitioning with your boss for beer breaks instead of smoke breaks, and trying to get a tap handle installed in the lunch room. There’s nothing wrong with that. That’s thinking outside the box right? 

Here at Rough Draft, we like to reward that forward thinking with handcrafted beers that are as unique in character as those who drink it. We favor style over perfection and take joy in sharing our great-tasting creations with those who simply love to try new beer. 

The beers that prove to be winners in our tasting room will be the ones we put into distribution.

breweries.name: The Dayton Beer Company
breweries.description:
The Dayton Beer Company is a multiple Award Winning Brewery and was voted  Dayton’s Best Microbrewery in 2014.  Our Pilot Brewery and Taproom is located in Kettering, Ohio.  We are in the process of opening our Production Brewery and Bier Hall in Downtown Dayton.

We are proud to be the first true Microbrewery in the Dayton area in over 50 years. All of our beer is hand-crafted with no automation in small batches with our own unique recipes. This allows us to create beers tailored with our own vision and style.

The Dayton Beer Company remembers all those who came before us and treasure their legacy by naming our core brews after them. Be sure to look for us at your favorite watering holes and retailers. As always, we encourage everyone to stop by our brewery to enjoy the fruits of our labor and relax and have fun in our cozy tap-room.

We love craft beer, and Crystal Lake Brewing is all about the beer. We love drinking great beers, we love making them, and we can't wait to share them with you. Our goal is simple, to produce world-­class beers right here in Crystal Lake.

Starting this summer, you'll be able to enjoy Crystal Lake Brewing Co. beer at restaurants and bars throughout Illinois, but we'd also like you to come visit us in person in our on-­premises tap room. Here, you can sample our beers in an open, relaxed space, then sit back and enjoy a pint or two of your favorite, all while admiring the brewhouse.

The Crystal Lake Brewing Co. is a production brewery, and we're totally focused on producing top-­notch beers. We won’t be serving any food in the tap room, but you'll be welcome to bring it in with you or order delivery from one of the nearby eateries. From time to time, expect to see a food truck parked just outside the front door, where you can grab a casual bite.

The tap room will always be pouring our best known beers, but you'll always find "pilot" brews, too. These unique beers will be brewed in smaller quantities and will be available only here at the brewery. Something new will always be on tap.

Of course, brewery tours will be offered, too.

Look for "CLB" beer at your favorite tavern or restaurant this summer, or at a local summertime festival. Don’t forget to come on in and visit us in the tap room. We’ll have a pint waiting for you. Cheers!

style.name: American-Style Pale Ale
style.description: American pale ales range from deep golden to copper in color. The style is characterized by fruity, floral and citrus-like American-variety hop character producing medium to medium-high hop bitterness, flavor, and aroma. Note that the "traditional" style of this beer has its origins with certain floral, fruity, citrus-like, piney, resinous, or sulfur-like American hop varietals. One or more of these hop characters is the perceived end, but the perceived hop characters may be a result of the skillful use of hops of other national origins. American pale ales have medium body and low to medium maltiness. Low caramel character is allowable. Fruity-ester flavor and aroma should be moderate to strong. Diacetyl should be absent or present at very low levels. Chill haze is allowable at cold temperatures.

breweries.name: Junkyard Brewing Company
breweries.description: Junkyard Brewing Company was conceived as I brewed my first batch of homebrew in college. I still remember that batch; it was a five-gallon recipe with eight pounds of dark malt extract powder and eight ounces of chinook hops for the boil with a packet of dry yeast to ferment it. I "bottled" this first batch in pint-sized canning jars and judged when the natural carbonation had taken place by the "plink, plink" noises of the lids buckling upward under pressure. Friends suggested names for my first brew, and a couple stand out in my mind: "Junk's Trunk" and "Junkyard" beer. It was  nicknames like these that helped guide me toward choosing the name "Junkyard" for our brewing company when the time came to  attach a name to my idea.

All of our beers are brewed in very small batches so they are always fresh and at their peak. Our brewers consistently bring home awards from the Great American Beer Festival, 24 medals so far. Our award-winning beers are brewed at all three locations, where our brewers strive to push the creative envelope.  Our beer selection is both consistent, with four flagship brands, and fresh with new offerings of seasonal and dark beers.

Unfortunately we can not go under the Steelhead name due to Trademark issues so we will be McKenzie Brewing Company.

data.name: White Marlin Pale Ale
data.description: This is our interpretation of true American style pale ale. It has an amber color and a smooth, full-flavored taste with a crisp finish. breweries.name: Fin City Brewing Co.
breweries.description: “I HAVE AN IDEA!”  That is how it all started.  Two years ago at our annual Brews on the Beach Beer Festival, Hooper’s was approached by a local gentleman named Vince Wright.  He had recently won first place with his “garage brewed” Pumpkin Ale at the infamous Pumpkin Chunkin.  With the growing trend and demand for hand crafted beers, and the fact nothing tastes better to wash down great crabs and old bay, we not only jumped, but dove head first into the world of craft brewing.  We created the brewing equipment, devised a system and here we are today.  With the help and guidance of a few experts along the way Hooper’s brings to you Fin City Brewing, Ocean City’s Oldest Brewery.

breweries.name: White Flame Brewing Company
breweries.description:
We love beer. We love trying new beers, tasting unique flavors, and talking about how amazing craft beer diversity can be. White Flame started with home brewing in our garage and grew into something none of us imagined.


We may not take ourselves seriously, but we take our beers to heart. We put everything we have into our beers for you, and us, to enjoy.

We are proud to be part of the craft beer explosion in Michigan, and are honored to stand with our fellow breweries as representatives of Beer City USA.

What could be better? Brew beer, drink beer, talk beer.

data.name: Whiter Shade of Pale
data.description: Starr Hill’s Whiter Shade of Pale marries two bold beer styles: the Belgian Wit and the IPA. Two row and wheat malt provide a soft base beer for intense fruity and spicy esters of the unique Belgian yeast strain while enhancing the strong hop aroma. Whiter Shade is a refreshing IPA to enjoy during the summer.

breweries.name: Starr Hill Brewery
breweries.description:
In the mid-90s, Mark Thompson returned to his native Virginia from Portland, OR, ready to begin crafting artisanal beer using his own recipes. He found the perfect spot in Charlottesville, VA – an historic storefront on Main Street that was once home to the state of Virginia’s first craft brewing operation. In September 1999, Starr Hill Brewery was founded. Named after the local neighborhood, the brewery shared its space with the legendary Starr Hill Music Hall. Since then Starr Hill's delicious craft beers have become a favorite to visiting beer lovers, musicians, and music fans from around the world.

In response to the growing demand, Starr Hill moved from this small operation to a larger facility several miles outside of town in 2005. The brewery and tap room are still based in Crozet, nestled in the rolling foothills of the Blue Ridge Mountains. Starr Hill's year-round, seasonal and limited-release brews are now enjoyed in bars, restaurants and music venues in the Mid Atlantic and Southeast and are also available at many grocery and convenience stores throughout the region. Among the most award-winning breweries on the East Coast, Starr Hill has won 21 Great American Beer Festival, World Beer Cup and Great British Beer Festival medals.

Led by Brewmaster Robbie O'Cain, Starr Hill's team is striving to make creative and world-class beer every day. Join us as we write the next chapter in our story of Virginia craft beer.

breweries.name: Hereford & Hops Restaurant and Brewpub
breweries.description: Hereford and Hops opened in downtown Escanaba, on the first floor of a historic 1914 five-story former hotel. The restored building has two dining rooms, a pub and two brick open grills. Since 1994 Hereford and Hops has specialized in a do-it-yourself style of dining with the choice to grill your own steak, seafood or chicken. With grill chefs on duty, you can always choose to have your entrée professionally grilled.

data.name: Wickked Sheryl’s Blush Pale Ale
data.description: As we hop into the Spring season, it’s time for a beer that’ll make you blush. We blend our strawberry-infused pale ale with Columbus and Simcoe hops to bring out a subtle hint of fruitiness and citrus. At the end of the day, Wickked Sheryl’s Blush Pale Ale is a crisp fruit beer that pours a hazy golden color with a dry finish, and does its best to pay homage to Spring. Fill up the pool, run through the sprinklers, and pour yourself a Wickked Sheryl as you light up the grill. To warmer days ahead and thirst-quenching beer!

breweries.name: Bad Tom Smith Brewing
breweries.description:
On June 28, 1895, after confessing to the murder of six people, “Bad Tom” Smith uttered his final words before meeting a hangman’s noose in Breathitt County, Ky.: “Bad women and bad whiskey have brought me where I am. I give you this warning: Don’t drink bad whiskey and don’t do as I have done.”

While he doesn’t think highly of his great-great uncle, Sean Smith, Bad Tom co-owner, has turned his relative’s evil deeds into a namesake for a local brewery. “My penance is to make good beer for all the bad whiskey he drank,” Smith quips.

After talking and sharing his great-great uncle’s story with Charles Boucher, co-owner and master brewer, they decided to change the name to Bad Tom Smith Brewing.

Boucher’s beer list includes the flagship Bad Tom Smith, a reddish brown ale. Other favorites are Brother Clement, a white Belgian ale brewed with more than a 100 pounds of clementines, and Old Abe American Ale, an American-style ale based on English beers with a dark amber color.

breweries.name: Green Bench Brewing Co.
breweries.description: In the early 1900's St. Petersburg was known as "the Green Bench City". At their height some 2,500 benches lined the downtown sidewalks inviting passers-by to slow their pace and make friends of strangers. In the same way Green Bench beer will serve as a catalyst for community and cheer. People will gather around a pint (or two) to share in both good times and bad, to discuss business or tell a joke, to reminisce about life or dream about the future, to get up and dance to the music or to just sit back, relax, and enjoy the brew.
